destinations.name: Art in the Valley
destinations.description: "Natural Woman" is an exciting new show by Katheryn Byram featuring sculptures created from found objects. Katheryn's work is inspired by nature, and created with her extraordinary imagination.  Art in the Valley will host a tasty reception.

destinations.name: The Arts Center
destinations.description: Back by popular demand: Sumi Ink Club: a fun shared unplanned drawing with sumi ink, made with small brushes on a long roll of paper, everybody "owns" the drawing/painting. Build on what others did before, creating new beginnings, it is an ever changing, ever evolving communal work of art. Although it is mostly about the process, it also gives an amazing result!

destinations.name: ArtWorks (CEI) Gallery
destinations.description:
Anna Fidler
​Telepathy Quilt and Two Stars
Opening Reception Thursday May 19, 4-8pm (a part of the CAW)
​ArtWorks (CEI) Gallery
​408 SW Monroe Ave/161, Corvallis OR
​Project Space: "Dessert Desert" by Tropical Contemporary

destinations.name: Azure Fine Art Gallery
destinations.description: In May we welcome Portland based artist and curator Chris Haberman and his recent works based on songs, poems and prose.

destinations.name: Brittney West
destinations.description: View Britt's new artwork created at an art retreat at Shotpouch Creek Cabin inspired by the land and wildlife, including works painted with grass, moss and horsetail. See vintage material created into mixed media paintings featuring lush overgrowth!

destinations.name: Corvallis Swing
destinations.summary: Swing dancing at Old World Deli
destinations.description:
We will be dancing on stage at the Old World Deli as part of the monthly Corvallis Arts Walk!! 

Our time will be short but sweet. Let's dance and celebrate together!!

destinations.name: Cyrano's
destinations.description: Cyrano's Hosts Artist Siobhan Clancy-Burns, Silk scarves dyed in the tradition of Japanese Shibori patterns of Arashi and Itajime. Multiple colors and patterns, come get wrapped up in this artist medium!

destinations.name: Fairbanks Art Gallery
destinations.description:
Ben Buswell, award-winning sculptor and multimedia artist, will exhibit embellished photographs, mixed media drawings, sculpture and acrylic on canvas in the Fairbanks Gallery on the OSU campus in Corvallis May 2 through May 25.

On Wednesday, May 4, he will give a talk in Fairbanks Gallery at 5 p.m. A reception will be held prior to the talk at 4:30 p.m. The event is free and open to the public. Buswell also will speak in art classes and critique student work that day.

Buswell, a native of Dallas, Oregon, received a bachelor of fine arts from OSU in 2001. He went on to study at the University of Wisconsin, Madison, where he earned a master’s degree in 2004 and a master’s in fine art in 2005.

His work is temporal in nature, spanning a variety of media, from ceramics to incised photographs, using processes such as doubling and repetitive mark-making.

destinations.name: Foundry Annex
destinations.description:
WuXing refers to the five interacting forces of Chinese cosmology. By basing each painting on one of these forces—wood, fire, earth, metal or water—I am free to experiment with abstract texture and pattern, color and connotation. The little size is important to my process, not only because I like to work with small brushes and richly pigmented inks, but because the snapshot composition is so liberating.

Juliet Shen is a Seattle painter. She holds a Master's in typeface design from the University of Reading, England and creates work that utilizes a symbiosis between her drawing and typographic skills.

destinations.name: Jeff Hess Studio
destinations.description: Flowers, leaves, nuts and grain are treated like brushstrokes of light, texture & color in this exhibit of temporal painting photographs.  Using motors, pulleys and compressed air as "brushes", the unique qualities of natural materials are captured via photography.

destinations.name: Karen Wysopal Studio
destinations.description: Karen's delightful studio is holding an open house, down the hall from Voices Gallery.

destinations.name: Living Room Gallery
destinations.description: Drawings by the accomplished local artist Alice Marshall

destinations.name: Pegasus Gallery
destinations.description: Pegasus Gallery looks east to views of Oregon just beyond the valley bowl to big skies and deep valleys and breathtaking topography and wild horses rendered appreciatively b y artists Karen Miller, Sarah Strohmeyer, Bill Shumway and several local photographers.

destinations.name: The Rabbit Hole
destinations.description:
Special performance art event this month: Local blues dancers will be joining us from 7-8pm to get their feet a little dirty... with paint!

Rachel Urista's colorful paintings, finished and unfinished, will also be on display.

destinations.name: Studio Beatrice
destinations.description: "inky Fingers" features an array of original, hand-pulled prints from a diverse group of printmakers (no giclees or reproductions).  A special surprise from the Cascade Print Exchange will be displayed, as we enjoy music by Marshall Adams and refreshment including libations by Kathi from Spindrift.

destinations.name: Studio262
destinations.description: Opening Reception for our Photography Show, "From Our View" featuring the work of local 6-12 grade students! Music provided by local High School musicians. Come support the next generation of artists!

destinations.name: Voices Gallery
destinations.description:
Color inspires us - it surrounds us.  Each color has its own mood. 
Voices is exploring the color wheel in a 7 month long series.  May brings GREEN into focus.
Green Grass...Green Trees..Green flecks in the eyes of the people we see...New growth...
fresh perspective...green is a color that should be respected!
7 Artist will be exhibiting works - Please join the celebration!
